name: InternetAddress
comment:
An internet address.

This object holds an internet address. If this internet address is the result of a DNS lookup, the address also holds the hostname used to make the lookup. An Internet address combined with a port number represents an endpoint to which a socket can connect or a listening socket can bind.

type.name: type
type.comment: The dart-io.InternetAddress.type of the dart-io.InternetAddress specified what IP protocol.

LOOPBACK_IP_V4.name: LOOPBACK_IP_V4
LOOPBACK_IP_V4.comment: IP version 4 loopback address. Use this address when listening on or connecting to the loopback adapter using IP version 4 (IPv4).

LOOPBACK_IP_V6.name: LOOPBACK_IP_V6
LOOPBACK_IP_V6.comment: IP version 6 loopback address. Use this address when listening on or connecting to the loopback adapter using IP version 6 (IPv6).

ANY_IP_V4.name: ANY_IP_V4
ANY_IP_V4.comment: IP version 4 any address. Use this address when listening on all adapters IP addresses using IP version 4 (IPv4).

ANY_IP_V6.name: ANY_IP_V6
ANY_IP_V6.comment: IP version 6 any address. Use this address when listening on all adapters IP addresses using IP version 6 (IPv6).

address.name: address
address.comment: The numeric address of the host. For IPv4 addresses this is using the dotted-decimal notation. For IPv6 it is using the hexadecimal representation.

host.name: host
host.comment: The host used to lookup the address. If there is no host associated with the address this returns the numeric address.

rawAddress.name: rawAddress
rawAddress.comment: Get the raw address of this dart-io.InternetAddress. The result is either a 4 or 16 byte long list. The returned list is a copy, making it possible to change the list without modifying the dart-io.InternetAddress.

isLoopback.name: isLoopback
isLoopback.comment: Returns true if the dart-io.InternetAddress is a loopback address.

isLinkLocal.name: isLinkLocal
isLinkLocal.comment: Returns true if the dart-io.InternetAddresss scope is a link-local.

isMulticast.name: isMulticast
isMulticast.comment: Returns true if the dart-io.InternetAddresss scope is multicast.

constructors.comment:
Creates a new dart-io.InternetAddress from a numeric address.

If the address in dart-io.InternetAddress.InternetAddress-.address is not a numeric IPv4 (dotted-decimal notation) or IPv6 (hexadecimal representation). address dart-core.ArgumentError is thrown.

reverse.name: reverse
reverse.comment: Perform a reverse dns lookup on the dart-io.InternetAddress.address, creating a new dart-io.InternetAddress where the host field set to the result.

lookup.name: lookup
lookup.comment: Lookup a host, returning a Future of a list of dart-io.InternetAddresss. If dart-io.InternetAddress.lookup.type is dart-io.InternetAddressType.ANY, it will lookup both IP version 4 (IPv4) and IP version 6 (IPv6) addresses. If dart-io.InternetAddress.lookup.type is either dart-io.InternetAddressType.IP_V4 or dart-io.InternetAddressType.IP_V6 it will only lookup addresses of the specified type. The order of the list can, and most likely will, change over time.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-io.InternetAddress.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-io.InternetAddress.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-io.InternetAddress.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-io.InternetAddress.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-io.InternetAddress.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-io.InternetAddress.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-io.InternetAddress.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
